00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00035  *
00036  * lustre/obdclass/obdo.c
00037  *
00038  * Object Devices Class Driver
00039  * These are the only exported functions, they provide some generic
00040  * infrastructure for managing object devices
00041  */
00042 
00043 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_CLASS
00044 
00045 #include <linux/user_namespace.h>
00046 #ifdef HAVE_UIDGID_HEADER
00047 # include <linux/uidgid.h>
00048 #endif
00049 #include <obd_class.h>
00050 #include <lustre/lustre_idl.h>
00051 
00052 void obdo_set_parent_fid(struct obdo *dst, const struct lu_fid *parent)
00053 {
00054         dst->o_parent_oid = fid_oid(parent);
00055         dst->o_parent_seq = fid_seq(parent);
00056         dst->o_parent_ver = fid_ver(parent);
00057         dst->o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLGENER | OBD_MD_FLFID;
00058 }
00059 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obdo_set_parent_fid);
00060 
00061 /* WARNING: the file systems must take care not to tinker with
00062    attributes they don't manage (such as blocks). */
00063 void obdo_from_inode(struct obdo *dst, struct inode *src, u64 valid)
00064 {
00065         u64 newvalid = 0;
00066 
00067         if (valid & (OBD_MD_FLCTIME | OBD_MD_FLMTIME))
00068                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "valid "LPX64", new time %lu/%lu\n",
00069                         valid, LTIME_S(src->i_mtime),
00070                         LTIME_S(src->i_ctime));
00071 
00072         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLATIME) {
00073                 dst->o_atime = LTIME_S(src->i_atime);
00074                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLATIME;
00075         }
00076         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLMTIME) {
00077                 dst->o_mtime = LTIME_S(src->i_mtime);
00078                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLMTIME;
00079         }
00080         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLCTIME) {
00081                 dst->o_ctime = LTIME_S(src->i_ctime);
00082                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLCTIME;
00083         }
00084         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLSIZE) {
00085                 dst->o_size = i_size_read(src);
00086                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLSIZE;
00087         }
00088         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS) {  /* allocation of space (x512 bytes) */
00089                 dst->o_blocks = src->i_blocks;
00090                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS;
00091         }
00092         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLBLKSZ) {   /* optimal block size */
00093                 dst->o_blksize = 1U << src->i_blkbits;
00094                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLBLKSZ;
00095         }
00096         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLTYPE) {
00097                 dst->o_mode = (dst->o_mode & S_IALLUGO) |
00098                               (src->i_mode & S_IFMT);
00099                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLTYPE;
00100         }
00101         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLMODE) {
00102                 dst->o_mode = (dst->o_mode & S_IFMT) |
00103                               (src->i_mode & S_IALLUGO);
00104                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLMODE;
00105         }
00106         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLUID) {
00107                 dst->o_uid = from_kuid(&init_user_ns, src->i_uid);
00108                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLUID;
00109         }
00110         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLGID) {
00111                 dst->o_gid = from_kgid(&init_user_ns, src->i_gid);
00112                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLGID;
00113         }
00114         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS) {
00115                 dst->o_flags = src->i_flags;
00116                 newvalid |= OBD_MD_FLFLAGS;
00117         }
00118         dst->o_valid |= newvalid;
00119 }
00120 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obdo_from_inode);
00121 
00122 void obdo_cpy_md(struct obdo *dst, const struct obdo *src, u64 valid)
00123 {
00124         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "src obdo "DOSTID" valid "LPX64", dst obdo "DOSTID"\n",
00125                POSTID(&src->o_oi), src->o_valid, POSTID(&dst->o_oi));
00126         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLATIME)
00127                 dst->o_atime = src->o_atime;
00128         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLMTIME)
00129                 dst->o_mtime = src->o_mtime;
00130         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLCTIME)
00131                 dst->o_ctime = src->o_ctime;
00132         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLSIZE)
00133                 dst->o_size = src->o_size;
00134         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS) /* allocation of space */
00135                 dst->o_blocks = src->o_blocks;
00136         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLBLKSZ)
00137                 dst->o_blksize = src->o_blksize;
00138         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLTYPE)
00139                 dst->o_mode = (dst->o_mode & ~S_IFMT) | (src->o_mode & S_IFMT);
00140         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLMODE)
00141                 dst->o_mode = (dst->o_mode & S_IFMT) | (src->o_mode & ~S_IFMT);
00142         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLUID)
00143                 dst->o_uid = src->o_uid;
00144         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLGID)
00145                 dst->o_gid = src->o_gid;
00146         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS)
00147                 dst->o_flags = src->o_flags;
00148         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLFID) {
00149                 dst->o_parent_seq = src->o_parent_seq;
00150                 dst->o_parent_ver = src->o_parent_ver;
00151         }
00152         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLGENER)
00153                 dst->o_parent_oid = src->o_parent_oid;
00154         if (valid & OBD_MD_FLHANDLE)
00155                 dst->o_handle = src->o_handle;
00156 
00157         dst->o_valid |= valid;
00158 }
00159 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obdo_cpy_md);
00160 
00161 void obdo_to_ioobj(const struct obdo *oa, struct obd_ioobj *ioobj)
00162 {
00163         ioobj->ioo_oid = oa->o_oi;
00164         if (unlikely(!(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLGROUP)))
00165                 ostid_set_seq_mdt0(&ioobj->ioo_oid);
00166 
00167         /* Since 2.4 this does not contain o_mode in the low 16 bits.
00168          * Instead, it holds (bd_md_max_brw - 1) for multi-bulk BRW RPCs */
00169         ioobj->ioo_max_brw = 0;
00170 }
00171 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obdo_to_ioobj);
